topPRs.title: Add AsterPay plugin reference to index.json
topPRs.author: timolein74
topPRs.body:
x402 payment plugin with EUR off-ramp via SEPA Instant for European AI agents. Features: - MAKE_PAYMENT, RECEIVE_PAYMENT, CHECK_BALANCE, CONVERT_TO_EUR - MiCA-compliant, ERC-8004 compatible Demo: https://asterpay.io/elizaos Repo: https://github.com/AsterPay/plugin-payments # Registry Update Checklist Registry: - [x] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name - [x] I've used github not github.com - [x] There is no .git extension - [x] It's placed it alphabetically in the list - [x] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: The plugin repo has: - [x] is publically accessible (not a private repo) - [x ] uses main as it's default branch - [x] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well. - [x] add simple description in github repo - [x] follows this convention ``` plugin-name/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logo.jpg # Plugin branding logo ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ banner.jpg # Plugin banner image ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts # Main plugin entry point ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ actions/ # Plugin-specific actions ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ clients/ # Client implementations ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ adapters/ # Adapter implementations ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts # Type definitions ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ environment.ts # runtime.getSetting, zod validation ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json # Plugin dependencies ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md # Plugin documentation ``` - [x] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they - Use clear, high-resolution images - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners) - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit) - Include alt text for accessibility - [x] package.json has a agentConfig like the following ```json { "name": "@myNpmOrg/plugin-example", "version": "1.0.0", "agentConfig": { "pluginType": "elizaos:plugin:1.0.0", "pluginParameters": { "API_KEY": { "type": "string", "description": "API key for the service" } } } } ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added support for the payments plugin, enabling new payment processing capabilities. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the AsterPay payment plugin to the registry, which provides EUR off-ramp functionality via SEPA Instant for European AI agents. **Changes:** - Added `@asterpay/plugin-payments` entry to `index.json` pointing to `github:AsterPay/plugin-payments` - Entry is correctly placed in alphabetical order (first entry after opening brace, before `@bealers`) - Follows the required format: NPM package name mapped to GitHub repository reference - JSON syntax is valid with proper comma placement **Repository Verification:** The PR description indicates the plugin includes: - Actions: MAKE_PAYMENT, RECEIVE_PAYMENT, CHECK_BALANCE, CONVERT_TO_EUR - MiCA-compliant and ERC-8004 compatible - Demo available at https://asterpay.io/elizaos - Repository at https://github.com/AsterPay/plugin-payments The PR author has confirmed completion of the registry checklist including proper NPM package naming, GitHub reference format, alphabetical placement, and plugin repository requirements (public repo, main branch, `elizaos-plugins` topic, proper structure, images, and `agentConfig` in package.json).

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The change is a simple, well-formatted addition to the registry index. The entry follows all formatting requirements: correct alphabetical placement, proper JSON syntax, valid NPM package name format, and correct GitHub reference format without .git extension. The author has completed the comprehensive checklist verifying the plugin repository meets all requirements. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `@asterpay/plugin-payments` entry in correct alphabetical position with proper format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant CI as GitHub Actions participant Generated as generated-registry.json Dev->>PR: Submit PR with new plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add "@asterpay/plugin-payments" Note over Registry: Entry added alphabetically
Format: NPM name ‚Üí GitHub repo PR->>CI: Trigger on merge to main CI->>Registry: Read index.json CI->>CI: Fetch repo metadata
(tags, branches, package.json) CI->>Generated: Generate registry with metadata Generated-->>CI: Commit updated file Note over Generated: Available for CLI consumption ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: Add @erdgecrawl/plugin-base-signals ‚Äî Base L2 smart money signals
topPRs.author: erdGeclaw
topPRs.body:
## Plugin: @erdgecrawl/plugin-base-signals **Real-time smart money signals, whale tracking, and token safety scoring on Base L2.** ### What it does - üêã **GET_BASE_SIGNALS** ‚Äî Latest smart money/whale activity on Base - üìä **SCORE_BASE_TOKEN** ‚Äî Token safety + signal score (0-100) - üîç **GET_BASE_NEW_PAIRS** ‚Äî New Uniswap/Aerodrome listings with safety checks - üõ°Ô∏è GoPlus integration for honeypot detection, tax analysis ### Links - **Repository:** https://github.com/erdGeclaw/plugin-base-signals - **Landing Page:** https://ulol.li - **API Docs:** https://api.ulol.li - **Live Dashboard:** https://dashboard.ulol.li - **Free Trial:** 7-day trial key at https://ulol.li ### Notes - Only `index.json` modified (one entry added, alphabetically sorted) - Package format: `github:erdGeclaw/plugin-base-signals` - Compatible with elizaOS v1.x - Built by erdGecrawl ü¶é ‚Äî an autonomous trading agent on Base ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Release Notes * **Bug Fixes** * Corrected a plugin mapping configuration entry to ensure consistent reference alignment and proper plugin resolution.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the `@erdgecrawl/plugin-base-signals` plugin to the elizaOS registry. The plugin provides real-time smart money signals, whale tracking, and token safety scoring on Base L2. **Changes:** - Added single entry to `index.json` mapping `@erdgecrawl/plugin-base-signals` to `github:erdGeclaw/plugin-base-signals` - Entry is correctly positioned alphabetically between `@elizaos/plugin-zytron` and `@esscrypt/plugin-polkadot` - Follows standard registry format: NPM package name ‚Üí GitHub repository reference - No other files modified (as required by contribution guidelines) **Validation:** - ‚úì Correct JSON format with proper commas - ‚úì Uses `github:` prefix (not `github.com`) - ‚úì No `.git` extension - ‚úì Alphabetically sorted - ‚úì Follows the same pattern as other third-party plugins in the registry

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge - it correctly adds a single plugin registry entry following all required conventions - The change is minimal and follows all registry requirements: only modifies index.json, uses correct format (github: prefix without .git extension), maintains alphabetical ordering, and follows the standard pattern seen in other third-party plugins - No files require special attention

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant GHA as GitHub Action participant Generated as generated-registry.json participant Users as elizaOS Users Dev->>PR: Submit PR adding plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add "@erdgecrawl/plugin-base-signals" Note over Registry: Entry added alphabetically
between @elizaos/plugin-zytron
and @esscrypt/plugin-polkadot PR->>GHA: Merge triggers automation GHA->>Generated: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>Generated: Process version, branches, compatibility GHA->>Generated: Update generated-registry.json Users->>Generated: elizaOS CLI fetches registry Users->>Users: Install plugin via package manager ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: @elizaos/plugin-datai added
topPRs.author: germashevanton
topPRs.body:
# Registry Update Checklist

Registry:
- [ ] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name
- [ ] I've used github not github.com
- [ ] There is no .git extension
- [ ] It's placed it alphabetically in the list
- [ ] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON

If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: 

The plugin repo has:
- [ ] is publically accessible (not a private repo)
- [ ] uses main as it's default branch
- [ ] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well.
- [ ] add simple description in github repo
- [ ] follows this convention
```
plugin-name/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logo.jpg        # Plugin branding logo
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ banner.jpg      # Plugin banner image
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts        # Main plugin entry point
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ actions/        # Plugin-specific actions
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ clients/        # Client implementations
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ adapters/       # Adapter implementations
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts        # Type definitions
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ environment.ts  # runtime.getSetting, zod validation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json        # Plugin dependencies
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md          # Plugin documentation
```
- [ ] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they
  - Use clear, high-resolution images
  - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners)
  - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit)
  - Include alt text for accessibility
- [ ] package.json has a agentConfig like the following
```json

import { dataiPlugin } from "@elizaos/plugin-datai";

export default {
  plugins: ["@elizaos/plugin-datai"],
  // ... other configuration
};

topPRs.title: Add @kamiyo/eliza plugin
topPRs.author: kamiyo-ai
topPRs.body:
## Summary Adds @kamiyo/eliza - an ElizaOS plugin for escrow payments, dispute resolution, and on-chain reputation on Solana. **Features:** - 5 actions: CREATE_KAMIYO_ESCROW, RELEASE_KAMIYO_ESCROW, FILE_KAMIYO_DISPUTE, CONSUME_PAID_API, CHECK_KAMIYO_REPUTATION - 3 providers: wallet context, active escrows, reputation history - 2 evaluators: quality assessment, trust scoring - 1 service: escrow monitoring with auto-dispute **Links:** - Package: https://github.com/kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol/tree/main/packages/kamiyo-eliza - Protocol: https://kamiyo.ai - Solana Program: [8sUnNU6WBD2SYapCE12S7LwH1b8zWoniytze7ifWwXCM](https://solscan.io/account/8sUnNU6WBD2SYapCE12S7LwH1b8zWoniytze7ifWwXCM)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary Adds `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin to the registry - an ElizaOS plugin for Solana-based escrow payments, dispute resolution, and on-chain reputation management. **Issues Found:** - Entry is placed incorrectly in alphabetical order (should come after `@esscrypt/plugin-polkadot`, not before) - Uses non-standard GitHub reference format `#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza` for monorepo access - this syntax is not documented and no other entries use it - Unclear if the monorepo path syntax is supported by elizaOS's dynamic plugin loader **Recommended Actions:** - Fix alphabetical ordering by moving the entry to the correct position - Verify the monorepo syntax works with elizaOS, or restructure to use standard format ### Confidence Score: 2/5 - This PR has critical issues that must be resolved before merging - Score reflects incorrect alphabetical ordering (violates registry requirements) and use of undocumented monorepo syntax that may not be supported by the plugin loader - The `index.json` file requires corrections to alphabetical ordering and potentially the GitHub reference format

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 2/5 | Added `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin entry with alphabetical ordering issue and non-standard monorepo path format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant Validator as Registry Validator participant CLI as elizaOS CLI participant Loader as Plugin Loader Dev->>PR: Submit plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add @kamiyo/eliza entry Note over Registry: Entry added at line 206 Validator->>Registry: Check alphabetical order Registry-->>Validator: ‚ùå Out of order (@kamiyo before @esscrypt) Validator->>Registry: Check GitHub format Registry-->>Validator: ‚ö†Ô∏è Non-standard format (#main:packages/...) alt If merged with issues CLI->>Loader: Load plugin from registry Loader->>Loader: Parse github:kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza Loader-->>CLI: ‚ùì Unknown if monorepo syntax supported end Note over Dev,Loader: Required fixes:
1. Move entry after @esscrypt
2. Verify monorepo syntax compatibility ```

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 2/5 | Added `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin entry with alphabetical ordering issue and non-standard monorepo path format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant Validator as Registry Validator participant CLI as elizaOS CLI participant Loader as Plugin Loader Dev->>PR: Submit plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add @kamiyo/eliza entry Note over Registry: Entry added at line 206 Validator->>Registry: Check alphabetical order Registry-->>Validator: ‚ùå Out of order (@kamiyo before @esscrypt) Validator->>Registry: Check GitHub format Registry-->>Validator: ‚ö†Ô∏è Non-standard format (#main:packages/...) alt If merged with issues CLI->>Loader: Load plugin from registry Loader->>Loader: Parse github:kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza Loader-->>CLI: ‚ùì Unknown if monorepo syntax supported end Note over Dev,Loader: Required fixes:
1. Move entry after @esscrypt
2. Verify monorepo syntax compatibility ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
